title: Convex lens - image when doubling f and obj distnc

content.question: A building is a distance <math alttext="d sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math> from a lens of focal length <math alttext="f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, resulting in a real image that is a distance <math alttext="d sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>i</mi></msub></math> from the lens. A second lens, with focal length <math alttext="2 f sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>f</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, is used to make an image of a second building that is a distance <math alttext="2 d sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>d</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math> away. How far from the second lens is the image of the second building?
